summary:
With left and right brain active in equal measure, I have a rich, entrepreneurial background in visual arts. My interactive art project, InterART, provides an excellent bridge between my organizational talents and my desire to offer creative experiences in unexpected places.  

I have had the fortunate privilege of being able to develop a professional life full of change, growth and creativity and I am always looking for opportunities to bring art to as many environments and as many people as I can.

profile_positions.description:
I am a primarily self-taught artist and have been painting since I was 13. Originally from California, I attended UCSC as a Math major while taking classes in art, creative writing, anthropology and women studies.
My artistic process is a delicate dance between intention and chance, as I allow the materials to guide me in the creation of my pieces. The texture of the paint, the way it flows and dries, becomes a major player in the story I am telling with each piece. The result is a rich tapestry of color and texture that invites the viewer on a journey through the imagination.
profile_positions.title: Artist

profile_positions.description:
ExposingARTS helps connect people to the arts.... all manner of art. Regardless of whether you see your pursuits as artistic or not, I believe that getting in touch with your creative spirit is what brings connection regardless of your position. My job is to help you embrace and manifest that creativity in a natural and engaged setting.

I provide support services to galleries, artists and all manner of creatives. Some of the services I provide include, but are not limited to: artist support and representation, presentations, workshops, discussion leading, speech writing, creative coaching and all around general cheerleading. I want you to get the most from your creative endeavors, whatever they might be. 

Galleries: 
Galeria Contrast, Barcelona
Aandenken/Battalion, Amsterdam

Art Fairs:
Moniker Art Fair, London 2014
Realisme Art Fair, Amsterdam 2015 & 2016
Koelner Liste Fair, Cologne 2015
Contemporary Istanbul, Istanbul 2015
KunstRai, Amsterdam 2016, 2017 &2018
Scope Art Fair, Basel 2014, 2016 & 2017
ForReal Art Fair, Amsterdam 2017
Context, Art Miami, Miami 2017 & 2018

Artists:

Peter Smith
David Shillinglaw

profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
Established a financial consultancy that provided small and medium business owners with financial expertise, management and oversight. Created a network of over thirty third party vendors (bookkeepers, accountants, insurance brokers, investment planners) to support clients on an outsourced basis.

 
Responsibilities
-Worked one-on-one with principals/shareholders to audit financials.
-Modeled financial statements for better planning and budgeting.
-Served as external Controller for tax inquiries, correspondence with accountants, payroll tax regulations and sales tax audits.
-Planned and delivered workshops instructing business owners on accounting processes and increasing financial awareness.
-Trained business owners and bookkeepers on record keeping to GAAP standards, directly impacting growth.
-Presented overview of business liabilities in regards to employees, contractors, taxes, insurance and the ongoing need for financial analysis for business vitality.

Achievements
-Implemented and audited financial systems for over 60 small businesses with annual revenue ranging from $80k to $2 million.
-Optimized AR processes to maximize efficiency, improving payment frequency and accuracy.
-Implemented cost savings by reviewing expenditures and redesigning budgets. 
-Recurring speaker for American Photography Association finance events regarding general accounting principles, budgeting and industry specific needs.
profile_positions.title: Owner

volunteer_experiences.description:
After the US election cycle, I connected with Women's March initiative in the states and co-founded the sister movement here in the Netherlands. With a small group of organizers and a ton of support from local organizations, we worked together to participate in the global march on January 21st 2017, which brought close to six thousand attendees in Amsterdam and Den Haag. Our second march, prior to the Dutch elections in 2017, sought to stimulate voters to select political agendas that emphasize equality rather than those parties that promote hate and fear. Our action on March 11th in Amsterdam drew twenty thousand people. 
As we examine the current climate here in the Netherlands, Women's March will continue to work towards creating a strong message of unity with existing organizations to build a stronger society.

- Initiated Women’s March organization with connection to US National brand in the Netherlands.
- Coordinated and project managed January 21st march in Amsterdam with over 4000 in attendance. 
- Created online presence, volunteer platforms and slack systems for organization.
- Created marketing materials and promotional materials for March 11th Amsterdam march.
- Managed liaisons with additional organization for March event. 
- Managed volunteers and additional PR efforts for March event with over 20,000 in attendance
- Created statutes and additional structural systems for the Organization

volunteer_experiences.role: QiGong Practice Leader and Programs Assistant
volunteer_experiences.description:
- Led weekly practice sessions for basic QiGong exercises.
- Worked independently with practitioners to refine their at-home practices. 
- Co-created and implemented multiple intensive workshops and retreat programs.
- Pursued and achieved “Continuing Education Provider” status for the company.
- Created a client registration database to tracking attendance.
- Implemented new financial systems to maintain accounting. 
- Created financial projections for offsite QiGong retreats.

- Co-developed non-profit to bring low-cost art workshops to local communities. 
- Drafted non-profit by-laws, implemented new accounting procedures and business operation guidelines. 
- Co-facilitated art workshops exploring art as an expression of emotion using the Zagon Method. 
- Created and executed public painting experience for a large annual AnonSalon New Year’s festival in San Francisco.
